did.abstract: Diary of a soldier with the 310th Engineers in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1919, the "Polar Bear Expedition."

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Jeanne Pedriana, of Elm Grove, Wisconsin, in 2010 (Donor No. 10365).

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

altformavail.p: This collection has not been digitized by the Bentley Historical Library.
As of May 20, 2013, the collection is available online at the "Detroit's Own" Polar Bear Memorial Association website at http://grobbel.org/pbma/rademacher.htm

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box. no., Paul Rademacher diary, 1918-1919, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Paul Rademacher served with Company A, 310th U.S. Engineers, during the American intervention at Archangel, Russia, the Polar Bear Expedition.

scopecontent.p: Printout of transcription of Rademacher's wartime diary.

note.p: As of May 20, 2013, the collection is available online at the "Detroit's Own" Polar Bear Memorial Association website at http://grobbel.org/pbma/rademacher.htm
